nodes.bodyText: Spring exception handlers do not support catching Throwables. The only reason this worked in the past is because of the annotation @ExceptionHandler({ SLException.class, IllegalArgumentException.class }). Basically, it caught only SLExceptions and IllegalArgumentExceptions and upcasted them to Throwable. However, I wanted this mapper to handle all kinds of exceptions without having to bloat that annotation with additional types. I also wanted to show the exception message regardless of the exception's type. That's why I removed the specific exception types from the annotation, and had to change the signature of the method to match what Spring supports.
